graph_title: Average marine acidity (pH) measured at agreed suite of representative sampling stations
indicator_name: Average marine acidity (pH) measured at agreed suite of representative sampling stations
SDG_GOAL: Goal 14: Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development
SDG_TARGET: Target 14.3: Minimize and address the impacts of ocean acidification, including through enhanced scientific cooperation at all levels
SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 14.3.1: Average marine acidity (pH) measured at agreed suite of representative sampling stations
STAT_CONC_DEF: Ocean acidification is the reduction in the pH of the ocean over an extended period, typically of decades or longer, which is caused primarily by the uptake of carbon dioxide from the atmosphere.
SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 14: Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development

fr.SDG_GOAL: Objectif 14 : Conserver et exploiter de manière durable les océans, les mers et les ressources marines aux fins du développement durable
fr.SDG_TARGET: Cible 14.3 : Réduire au maximum l’acidification des océans et lutter contre ses effets, notamment en renforçant la coopération scientifique à tous les niveaux
fr.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicateur 14.3.1 : Acidité moyenne des mers (pH) mesurée à plusieurs points de prélèvement représentatifs
fr.STAT_CONC_DEF: L’acidification des océans est la réduction du pH de l’océan sur une période prolongée, généralement de plusieurs décennies ou plus, causée principalement par l’absorption du dioxyde de carbone de l’atmosphère.
